edu.cmu.cs.lane.pipeline.dataanalyzer

Class AbstractAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.cs.lane.pipeline.dataanalyzer.AbstractAnalyzer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleAnalyzer, GFLassoAnalyzer, ShotgunAnalyzer

    public abstract class AbstractAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    AbstractAnalyzer is the abstract base class for all analyzers (algorithms) which are applied to genetic and clinical data to build computational models that represents insights from the data. In order for to add a new algorithm functionality to CGE, the developer will need to create a class that inherits from AbstractAnalyzer.

    An Analyzer object encapsulates the functionality of the analyzer and is called by the rest of the CGE framework through multiple methods:

    • getName() is called when the analyzer class is registered in the system
    • create(AbstractOptions) is called when an new analyzer object is created
    • loadLabels(AbstractOptions) is called when the sample labels (e.g., clinical variables, disease state) are being loaded. This method is called once in each analysis cycle.
    • loadData(AbstractOptions) is called when the genetic data for all samples is being loaded. In case the defined input is a directory, this method is called per file in the directory.
    • analyze(AbstractOptions, SamplesLabels, SamplesGeneticData) is called when the training algorithm is to be applied to the data. In case cross validation is defined, this method can be called for each iteration.
    • applyModel(AbstractOptions, CGEModel, SamplesLabels, SamplesGeneticData) is called when a model that was already generated by the training algorithm (in analyze(..)) needs to be applied to a new sample. It is common that this method will be called either when testing the model in during the cross validation procedure, or by the API services server that is called by the client when new data needs to be applied for a new sample.
    • saveModel(AbstractOptions, CGEModel) is called when the model that was generated needs to be stored (most likely to the database but possibly also to files.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    zinman
    See Also:
    ShotgunAnalyzer, GFLassoAnalyzer

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the class to be registered in the CGEframework so that objects from this class can be instantiated. The method is triggered when the class is registered. Every plugin must provide a unique name
        Returns:
        The unique name representing the relevant Analyzer
        See Also:
        DataAnalysisPhaseController

      • create

        public abstract AbstractAnalyzer create(AbstractOptions options)
        Instantiates an object from the relevant type. The method is triggered when an Analyzer object is created. The AbstractOptions object parameter is intended to pass additional parameters if necessary.
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        Returns:
        an instance to the new Analyzer object.

      • loadLabels

        public abstract SamplesLabels loadLabels(AbstractOptions options)
        Loads the clinical variables or disease labels of the patients samples to be trained on. This method is triggered when the CGE system loads the data based on the information in the properties file (including format and location of the input - either database, folder location, or a single file). This method will be called only once per each analysis cycle. Developers need to override this method only if they want to override or extend the CGE system default behavior. (CGE provides auxiliary objects that can handle input in multiple formats and sources and convert it to a matrix format).
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        Returns:
        SamplesLabels object with the clinical variables/disease labels to be trained on in analyze(AbstractOptions, SamplesLabels, SamplesGeneticData)

      • loadData

        public abstract SamplesGeneticData loadData(AbstractOptions options)
        Loads the genetic data of the patients samples to be trained on. This method is triggered when the CGE system loads the data based on the information in the properties file (including format and location of the input - either database, folder location, or a single file). By default if the input data refers to multiple chromosomes, this function will be triggered for each chromosome separately. Developers need to override this method only if they want to override or extend the CGE system default behavior. (CGE provides auxiliary objects that can handle input in multiple formats and sources and convert it to a matrix format).
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        Returns:
        SampleData object with the genetic data to be trained on in analyze(AbstractOptions, SamplesLabels, SamplesGeneticData)

      • analyze

        public abstract CGEModel analyze(AbstractOptions options,
               SamplesLabels labels,
               SamplesGeneticData samples)
        Performs the training phase of the analyzer/algorithm. This method is triggered when the CGE system starts to perform an analysis. By default if the input data refers to multiple chromosomes, this function will be triggered for each chromosome separately. If cross-validation is defined this function will be called for each iteration. The AbstractOptions object is intended to pass additional parameters if necessary.
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        labels - the clinical variables / disease labels for the training process. See loadLabels(AbstractOptions) for more info.
        samples - the genetic data information of the patients to be trained on
        Returns:
        CGEModel object with the model that was generated

      • applyModel

        public abstract CGEPrediction applyModel(AbstractOptions options,
                       CGEModel model,
                       SamplesLabels label,
                       SamplesGeneticData sample)
        Applies a model generated at the training phase to a specific patient sample. This method is triggered during the testing phase of the backend analysis or by a client side call to evaluate a CGEModel for a specific sample.
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        model - the model to validate the patient against.
        label - clinical or other information attached to the sample to be test (if needed)
        sample - the genetic data information of the specific sample
        Returns:
        CGEPrediction object with the result

      • saveModel

        public abstract int saveModel(AbstractOptions options,
            CGEModel model)
        Saves the CGEModel that was generated in analyze(AbstractOptions, SamplesLabels, SamplesGeneticData) to a database and/or file.
        Parameters:
        options - properties defined in the input properties file.
        model - the CGEModel to be saved
        Returns:
        model save version if applicable
